p.hi:
EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT,
Frankfort, Ky , 186
Dear Sir

body.p:
Hon Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky,

I acted as as counsel of James V Shackelford who is now in the state prison upon a charge of Murdering George Diorin. both in the examining Court and the Circuit before which he was convicted and heard all the testimoney given in the case. I give it sincerely as my opinion that the verdict of "guilty" brought in by the Jury was based upon the statement of a certain Jacob Claunche. who professed to detail all the facts & circumstances of the difficulty in which Diorin was killed, A number of witnesses were examined in both trials & no one of them so far as I can reccolect after being examined and cross-examined would state that
they saw Jacob Claunch upon the ground at the time of the difficulty. I will further say from all the evidence in the case I sincerely believe that Shackelford in all that he did acted in self defence and that the unfortunate difficulty was forced upon him
